titles.title: Member's Right to Renounce the House Pay Raise Act of 1997
To provide that a Member of, or Member-elect to, the House of Representatives shall not receive any annual pay increase except upon an appropriate written election.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.

bill.summary: 10/30/1997--Introduced. Member's Right to Renounce the House Pay Raise Act of 1997 - Prohibits a Member (or Member-elect) of the House of Representatives from receiving an annual pay increase unless such Member elects to receive such increase.
